product_description.product_name: ViroDecs™ Ready-mix concrete - NWS — Northern New South Wales - ECOPact
product_description.product_use: Construction material for residential, commercial, infrastructure projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, public works

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for residential applications, low rise buildings, paving, driveways etc. Simplified specification and ordering.
product_classes.special_class: Allows purchaser to specify special requirements such as high-strength, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural finishes, decorative applications.

product_description.mix_codes_and_strengths: Multiple mix codes listed with strengths ranging from 20 MPa to 50 MPa and various mix designations (e.g. Blockmix ECOPact, Concrete ECOPact, Ultraflow ECOPact, Rapidcrete ECOPact, Tilt-Up ECOPact).

content_declaration.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
content_declaration.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to gate)
databases_and_software_used: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI) (2018)
Global Cement and Concrete (GCCA) EPD Tool Project Database version 3.1 (International Version) (2021)
Product specific EPDs for pigments and fibres
lca_information.allocation: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible; fly ash and silica fumes considered waste and burden-free; ground granulated blast furnace slag allocated economically.
lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows excluded based on cut-off criteria
lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate; excludes use stage, end of life, benefits and loads outside system boundary; excludes environmental impacts relating to personnel, infrastructure and production equipment not directly consumed in the process
lca_information.excluded_lifecycle_stages: Use stage, end of life stage, benefits and loads outside system boundary
system_diagram_processes: Processing (steel manufacturing, chemical plant, admixture production)
Transport by transoceanic freight ship, rigid truck and/or domestic freight ship
lca_information.data_quality: Foreground data assessed medium or higher for geographic and temporal representativeness; background data updated within 10 years as required

scenarios: Disposal of concrete at landfill site
Reuse of recovered concrete elements in new construction works
Use of concrete debris in land restoration
Crushing/recycling of concrete: (a) crushed concrete substitutes primary material without further processing, (b) substitution of natural aggregates in fresh concrete
end_of_life.note: End of life scenarios 2, 3 and 4 can result in benefits and loads outside system boundary and should be considered in whole-of-life building studies or functional comparisons

carbonation.description: Concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere through carbonation after use stage, partially offsetting CO2 emissions from cement manufacturing
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results tables

global_warming_potential.values: Provided per mix code and strength in detailed tables for Northern New South Wales (Northern Rivers, Newcastle, Coffs Harbour regions)

other_impact_categories: Global warming potential (fossil, biogenic, land use/land transformation)
Abiotic depletion potential (elements and fossil fuels)
Use of renewable and non-renewable primary energy
Use of secondary materials and fuels
Materials for recycling and energy recovery
Additional impacts: particulate matter disease incidence, ionising radiation human health, eco-toxicity freshwater, human toxicity (cancer and non-cancer), soil quality
carbon_emission_context.detailed_results: Provided in tables per mix code and region for primary and additional environmental indicators

recycled_materials_handling.fly_ash: Considered waste product, burden-free except transport impacts included
recycled_materials_handling.silica_fume: Considered waste product, burden-free except transport impacts included
recycled_materials_handling.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value at collection point
recycled_materials_handling.allocation_approach: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

about_holcim.description: Holcim Australia is a leading supplier of construction materials since 1901, supplying aggregates, sand, ready-mix concrete, engineered precast and prestressed concrete solutions across Australia.
about_holcim.operations: Network of concrete plants, quarries, precast and concrete pipe plants, mobile and on-site project facilities across Australia.
about_holcim.sustainability_commitment: Industry’s first 2050 net-zero targets endorsed by Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi).
about_holcim.global_presence: 70,000 employees worldwide in Cement, Ready-Mix Concrete, Aggregates and Solutions & Products segments.
about_holcim.mission: Building progress for people and the planet, enabling greener cities, smarter infrastructure, improving living standards, driving circular construction and recycling.

virodecs_special.description: Project-specific, on-demand EPDs for ready-mix concrete in Australia, backed by third-party verified data and EPD Process Certification.
virodecs_special.significance: First EPD Process Certification for any product in Australia, enabling in-house compliant EPD production.
virodecs_special.application: Supports customers from tender through design and construction to optimise concrete mix designs and sustainability reporting.
virodecs_special.production_sites: Northern New South Wales ECOPact range produced at Holcim Northern NSW sites.
